paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR V142I variant, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.demographics: AA patients with heart failure or arrhythmia
patients.phenotype: ATTR-CM primarily manifesting as cardiac phenotype

individual_records.phenotype_details: HF or arrhythmia plus spinal stenosis, bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome, multi/chronic diarrhea, eye disease, and lower extremity numbness.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The TTR V142I homozygote was >65 years and female, with a diagnosis of HF or arrhythmia plus spinal stenosis, bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome, multi/chronic diarrhea, eye disease, and lower extremity numbness.
Of the 18 TTR V142I allele carriers, 38.9% were male, and 50% were 65 years of age or older.

functional_data.summary: The V142I variant destabilizes TTR tetramers, leading to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.population_frequency: Approximately 2.7% of the patients carried a TTR V142I allele (18/666).
variants.additional_notes: No other TTR variants were found in the cohort.
key_quotes: Despite the high prevalence of the TTR V142I variant in AA, there appears to be a substantial divergence between the number of TTR V142I carriers and diagnosed cases of ATTR-CM.
The allele frequencies of these variants are rare compared to p.Val142Ile (V142I, also referred to as V122I), carried by an estimated >3% of individuals of African American (AA) ancestry.

tables_processed.table_caption: Demographics and clinical characteristics of patients with heart failure or arrhythmia.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR V142I variant was successfully extracted.
